data.title: Museo del Traje || Exhibition: Man in Progress || until 02.11.2015
data.meta_description: The first retrospective of its kind to be held in Europe. A unique exhibition that reflects the fashion and male identity in the last twenty years. It will feature exclusive fashion pieces ranging from Tom Ford´s tuxedo designed to Daniel Craig for 007 movie "Quantum of Solace" (2008), the lunar tuxedo that Dolce & Gabbana…
data.text:
The first retrospective of its kind to be held in Europe. A unique exhibition that reflects the fashion and male identity in the last twenty years.

It will feature exclusive fashion pieces ranging from Tom Ford´s tuxedo designed to Daniel Craig for 007 movie “Quantum of Solace” (2008), the lunar tuxedo that Dolce & Gabbana designers created fot Lionel Messi to collect the Golden Ball in 2012, the look that the actor Adrien Brody wore in the parade of Autumn Winter 2012 Prada or the Louis Vuitton´s suit with which Andres Velencoso led the campaign that launched him to fame and starred with Jennifer Lopez. The exhibition also features a “Manolos” mens exclusively designed by Manolo Blahnik, a Salvatore Ferragamo shoes of Andy Warhol and a jacket courtesy matador bullfighter Miguel Angel Perera, among other spectacular designs.

Fashion is complete with a large exhibition of photographs by artists such as Annie Leibovitz, Inez van Lamsweerde & Vinoodh Matadin, Tony Kelly, Mario Sorrenti, Peter Lindberg, Eugenio Recuenco or Javier Salas.

Organizers: GQ Spain and Costume Museum

Curator: Marta Blanco and José Luis Díez Carpenter Garde

Location: Ground floor

Free assitance to temporal exhibitions.
